Description: Perforated vase, sherbet cup made of pale buff-coloured pipe clay, the lower part pierced with holes, in the neck an ornamental trainer surmounted by a bird.
Acquisition name: Purchased from: Somerset Lowry-Corry, 2nd Earl of Belmore
Acquisition notes: 1843,0507.291 to 1039 is a collection of antiquities from Egypt and neighbouring countries purchased from the Earl of Belmore, who had collected them when he travelled up the Nile as far as the second cataract in 1816-18. Within it there were 21 modern pieces, most of which are now considered to be from Ethiopia.
